intro: Alectra melampyroides var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth false nettle, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and slender, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
